member.name: T:Kraken.Net.Enums.TrailingStopDeviationUnit
member.summary: This defines how the trailing trigger price is calculated from the requested trigger signal. For example, if the max deviation is set to 10, the unit is 'PERCENT', and the underlying order is a sell, then the trigger price will never be more then 10% below the trigger signal. Similarly, if the deviation is 100, the unit is 'QUOTE_CURRENCY', the underlying order is a sell, and the contract is quoted in USD, then the trigger price will never be more than $100 below the trigger signal.

member.summary: Trigger when the price is above the trigger rpcei

member.name: F:Kraken.Net.Enums.TriggerSide.TriggerBelow
member.summary: Trigger when price is below the trigger price

member.name: M:Kraken.Net.Interfaces.Clients.FuturesApi.IKrakenRestClientFuturesApiTrading.CancelAllOrderAfterAsync(System.TimeSpan,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: This endpoint provides a Dead Man's Switch mechanism to protect the user from network malfunctions. The user can send a request with a timeout in seconds which will trigger a countdown timer that will cancel all user orders when timeout expires. The user has to keep sending request to push back the timeout expiration or they can deactivate the mechanism by specifying a timeout of zero (0). The recommended mechanism usage is making a call every 15 to 20 seconds and provide a timeout of 60 seconds.This allows the user to keep the orders in place on a brief network failure, while keeping them safe in case of a network breakdown.
member.param: Cancel after this time. TimeSpan.Zero to cancel a previous cancel after.

Price of the order:
Limit=limit price
StopLoss=stop loss price
TakeProfit=take profit price
StopLossProfit=stop loss price
StopLossProfitLimit=stop loss price
StopLossLimit=stop loss trigger price
TakeProfitLimit=take profit trigger price
TrailingStop=trailing stop offset
TrailingStopLimit=trailing stop offset
StopLossAndLimit=stop loss price

Secondary price of an order: StopLossProfit/StopLossProfitLimit=take profit price
StopLossLimit/TakeProfitLimit=triggered limit price
TrailingStopLimit=triggered limit offset
StopLossAndLimit=limit price
Only validate inputs, don't actually place the order
Password or authentication app code if enabled
Time-in-force of the order to specify how long it should remain in the order book before being cancelled

Prefix operator for the price field, `+` or `-` for a relative offset to the last traded price, `#` will either add or subtract the amount to the last traded price, depending on the direction and order type used. For trailing stop orders always `+` can be used for an absolute price
Suffix operator for the price field. Only option is `%` to specify a relative percentage offset for trailing orders

Prefix operator for the secondary price field, `+` or `-` for a relative offset to the last traded price, `#` will either add or subtract the amount to the last traded price, depending on the direction and order type used.
Suffix operator for the price field. Only option is `%` to specify a relative percentage offset for trailing orders
